unnormalised: Rental Agreements Getting a Modern Makeover, Bhai!
normalised: Rental Agreements Getting a Modern Makeover, Brother!

unnormalised: Mumbai: Tired of those old, musty rental agreements that seem like they were written during the Mughal era? Well, good news! Landlords and tenants across India are embracing digital agreements, making the whole process smoother than butter chicken.
normalised: Mumbai: Tired of those old, musty rental agreements that seem like they were written during the Mughal era? Well, good news! Landlords and tenants across India are embracing digital agreements, making the whole process smoother than butter chicken.

unnormalised: Forget running around for stamp paper worth Rs. 500 and waiting in queues longer than a line for a Salman Khan movie premiere. Now, you can often do everything online, even signing with your Aadhaar.
normalised: Forget running around for stamp paper worth rupee five hundred and waiting in queues longer than a line for a Salman Khan movie premiere. Now, you can often do everything online, even signing with your A A D H A A R.

unnormalised: Experts at the National Housing Bank (NHB) are recommending standardized digital formats for rental agreements to ensure transparency and protect both parties. This comes after a surge in rental disputes, especially in cities like Bangalore and Delhi, where finding a decent 1 BHK within 5 km of your office feels like winning the lottery.
normalised: Experts at the N H B are recommending standardized digital formats for rental agreements to ensure transparency and protect both parties. This comes after a surge in rental disputes, especially in cities like Bangalore and Delhi, where finding a decent one B H K within five kilometer of your office feels like winning the lottery.

unnormalised: Plus, many online platforms now offer built-in clauses for things like maintenance charges (Rs. 2000 per month, anyone?) and pet policies, making it easier to avoid misunderstandings later. So ditch the drama, embrace the digital, and happy renting! Just remember to read the fine print, yaar!
normalised: Plus, many online platforms now offer built-in clauses for things like maintenance charges (rupee two thousand per month, anyone?) and pet policies, making it easier to avoid misunderstandings later. So ditch the drama, embrace the digital, and happy renting! Just remember to read the fine print, friend!
